intro: Ionopsidium prolongoi subsp. abulense, commonly known as the Bulbous Ionopsidium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It is characterized by its bulbous base and slender, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in a spike-like inflorescence during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a dry climate to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
